intro: Phyllanthus lauterbachianus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub native to southern Africa, characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain seeds coated in a sticky substance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
